Event.0: The Large Hadron Collider at CERN, described as the biggest scientific experiment in the history of mankind is powered up in Geneva, Switzerland
Event.1: The Large Hadron Collider, the world's most powerful particle accelerator, conducted its first test operation.
Event.2: Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical Cats closed after 7,485 performances; it was the longest-running show on Broadway until it was surpassed by Lloyd Webber's Phantom of the Opera in 2006.
Event.3: "The X-Files", created by Chris Carter and starring David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson debuts on Fox
Event.4: Rock band Nirvana release their single "Smells like Teen Spirit"
Event.5: By winning the U.S. Open, Steffi Graf completed the Grand Slam of tennis; she was the first woman to accomplish the feat since Margaret Court in 1970.
Event.6: Hamida Djandoubi, convicted of torture and murder, is the last person to be executed by Guillotine in France
Event.8: American long distance runner Frank Shorter scores a famous win in the men's marathon in 2:12:19.8 at the Munich Olympics
Event.9:
Jack Ma
Chinese entrepreneur
was born
Event.10: Baseball player Ted Williams marries model Lee Howard (divorced 1967)
Event.11: Nigerian novelist, critic and academic Chinua Achebe ("Things Fall Apart") marries Christie Okoli
Event.12: Prime Minister of Canada Jean Chretien (23) weds Aline Chaine (21) in Canada
Event.13:
Bill O'Reilly
American television and radio personality
was born
Event.14:
Stephen Jay Gould
American paleontologist
was born
Event.15:
Cynthia Lennon
British personality
was born
Event.16: American professional baseball player Roger Maris, who held (1961–98) the record for most home runs (61) in a single season, was born.
Event.17: Leopold and Loeb found guilty of the murder of Robert Franks in Chicago in the "the crime of the century"
Event.18: Austria and the Allied powers signed the Treaty of Saint-Germain, concluding World War I.
Event.19: Elias Howe takes out a US patent for a lockstitch sewing machine
Event.20: U.S. naval forces under the command of Oliver Hazard Perry defeated the British in the Battle of Lake Erie during the War of 1812.
Event.21: George Washington asks for a spy volunteer, Nathan Hale volunteers
Event.22: The Second Northern War (1700–21) was concluded by the Peace of Nystad.
Event.23: Japanese rebel Yui Shosetsu committed suicide after the failure of his plot against the Tokugawa shogunate.
Event.24:
Marie-Thérèse of Austria
queen of France
was born
Event.25:
John Smith chosen president of Jamestown
Having survived capture by Indians (reputedly through the efforts of Pocahontas, a chief's daughter), John Smith became president of Jamestown colony, the first permanent English settlement in North America, this day in 1608.
Event.26: John the Fearless, second duke of Burgundy, was killed during a meeting with the future king Charles VII at Montereau, France.
